title: Modeling a Non-Periodic Context - Piecewise Function

content.description:
A student won <math alttext="$ 500"><mo>$</mo><mn>500</mn></math> in an art contest. At first, the student kept the money in a desk. After <math alttext="10"><mn>10</mn></math> months, the student deposited the money in a savings account that earned interest. Six months after depositing the money (<math alttext="t equals 6"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>), the amount in the account is <math alttext="$ 508.67"><mo>$</mo><mn>508.67</mn></math>. Twelve months after depositing the money (<math alttext="t equals 12"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math>), the amount in the account is <math alttext="$ 517.50"><mo>$</mo><mn>517.50</mn></math>.

The amount of money the student has can be modeled by the piecewise function <math alttext="M"><mi>M</mi></math> given by

<math alttext="M open parentheses t close parentheses equals 500 for negative 10 less than or equal to t less than 0, and M open parentheses t close parentheses equals a times b to the power of open parentheses t divided by 12 close parentheses end exponent for t greater than or equal to 0"> <mi>M</mi> <mfenced> <mi>t</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mfenced close="" open="{"> <mtable columnalign="left" columnspacing="1.4ex"> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>500</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext>for</mtext> <mo> </mo> <mo>-</mo> <mn>10</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>a</mi> <msup> <mi>b</mi> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>/</mo> <mn>12</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> </msup> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext>for</mtext> <mo> </mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≥</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mfenced> </math>,

where <math alttext="M open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>M</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is the amount, in dollars, at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> months since the <math alttext="$ 500"> <mo>$</mo> <mn>500</mn> </math> was deposited into the savings account. A negative value for <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> represents the number of months before the student deposited the <math alttext="$ 500"><mo>$</mo><mn>500</mn></math> into the savings account.
content.question:
Part A

(i) Use the given data to write two equations that can be used to find the values for constants <math> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math> <mi>b</mi> </math> in the expression for <math alttext="M open parentheses t close parentheses"> <mi>M</mi> <mfenced> <mi>t</mi> </mfenced> </math>.

(ii) Find the values for <math> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math> <mi>b</mi> </math> as decimal approximations.

frqParts.text:
Part A

(i) Use the given data to write two equations that can be used to find the values for constants <math> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math> <mi>b</mi> </math> in the expression for <math alttext="M open parentheses t close parentheses"> <mi>M</mi> <mfenced> <mi>t</mi> </mfenced> </math>.

(ii) Find the values for <math> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math> <mi>b</mi> </math> as decimal approximations.

Part B

(i) Use the given data to find the average rate of change of the amount of money the student has, in dollars per month, from <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDaiabg2da9iabgkHiTiaaikdaaaa@3B40@</annotation> </semantics> </math> to <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDaiabg2da9iaaigdacaaIYaaaaa@3B0E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> months. Express your answer as a decimal approximation. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(ii) Use <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>M</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>12</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamytaiaacIcacaaIXaGaaGOmaiaacMcaaaa@3B3A@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and the average rate of change found in part B (i) to estimate the amount of money, in dollars, the student has when <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDaiabg2da9iaaikdacaaIWaaaaa@3B0D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> months. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(iii) Let <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>A</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyqaiaayIW7caGGOaGaamiDaiaacMcaaaa@3C41@</annotation> </semantics> </math> be the estimate of the amount of money, in dollars, the student has at time <math> <semantics> <mi>t</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDaaaa@3891@</annotation> </semantics> </math> months using the average rate of change found in (i). In part B (ii), <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>A</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>20</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyqaiaacIcacaaIYaGaaGimaiaacMcaaaa@3B2D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> was computed. If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>A</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyqaiaayIW7caGGOaGaamiDaiaacMcaaaa@3C41@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is used to estimate values for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>M</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamytaiaacIcacaaIXaGaaGOmaiaacMcaaaa@3B3A@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>12</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDaiabg6da+iaaigdacaaIYaaaaa@3B10@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, the error in the estimates will increase as <math> <semantics> <mi>t</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDaaaa@3891@</annotation> </semantics> </math> increases. Explain why this is true. Your explanation should include a reference to the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>M</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamytaiaacIcacaaIXaGaaGOmaiaacMcaaaa@3B3A@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and its relationship to the estimates found using the average rate of change.

Part C

The student plans to close the account when the amount of money in the account reaches <math alttext="$ 500"> <mo>$</mo> <mn>565</mn> </math>. Explain how this information can be used to determine the domain limitations for the model <math> <semantics> <mi>M</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamytaaaa@386A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

topic.text: 1.3: Rates of Change in Linear and Quadratic Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
